name: Acid Armor
effect: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply raising its Defense stat.

name: Acrobatics
effect: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.

name: After You
effect: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.

name: Agility
effect: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

name: Air Cutter
effect: The user launches razor-like wind to slash the opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.

name: Air Slash
effect: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch.

name: Ally Switch
effect: The user teleports using a strange power and switches its place with one of its allies.

name: Amnesia
effect: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.

name: Ancient Power
effect: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also raise all the user's stats at once.

name: Aqua Jet
effect: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.

name: Aqua Ring
effect: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP every turn.

name: Aqua Tail
effect: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.

name: Arm Thrust
effect: The user looses a flurry of open-palmed arm thrusts that hit two to five times in a row.

name: Aromatherapy
effect: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions of the user's party.

name: Assist
effect: The user hurriedly and randomly uses a move among those known by ally Pokémon.

name: Astonish
effect: The user attacks the target while shouting in a startling fashion. This may also make the target flinch.

name: Attack Order
effect: The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.

name: Aura Sphere
effect: The user lets loose a blast of aura power. This attack never misses.

name: Aurora Beam
effect: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target's Attack stat.

name: Autotomize
effect: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raises its Speed stat.

name: Avalanche
effect: An attack move that inflicts double the damage if the user has been hurt by the target in the same turn.

name: Baby-Doll Eyes
effect: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes, which lowers the target's Attack stat. Always goes first.

name: Barrier
effect: The user throws up a sturdy wall that sharply raises its Defense stat.

name: Baton Pass
effect: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.

name: Beat Up
effect: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the more damage.

name: Belly Drum
effect: The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for HP equal to half its max HP.

name: Bestow
effect: The user passes its held item to the target when the target isn't holding an item.

name: Bide
effect: The user endures attacks for two turns, then strikes back to cause double the damage taken.

name: Bind
effect: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.

name: Bite
effect: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.

name: Blast Burn
effect: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can't move on the next turn.

name: Blaze Kick
effect: The user launches a kick with a high critical-hit ratio. This may also leave the target with a burn.

name: Blizzard
effect: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike the opposing Pokémon. This may also leave them frozen.

name: Block
effect: The user blocks the target's way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.

name: Body Press
effect: The user attacks by slamming its body into the target. The higher the user's Defense, the stronger the move.

name: Body Slam
effect: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

name: Bolt Strike
effect: The user surrounds itself with a great amount of electricity and charges its target. May cause paralysis.

name: Bone Club
effect: The user clubs the target with a bone. This may also make the target flinch.

name: Bone Rush
effect: The user strikes the target with a bone. Hits 2–5 times in a row.

name: Bonemerang
effect: The user throws a bone at the target. The bone loops around to hit the target twice—coming and going.

name: Bounce
effect: The user bounces up high, then drops on the target on the next turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

name: Brave Bird
effect: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. The user also takes serious damage.

name: Brick Break
effect: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.

name: Brine
effect: If the target's HP is half or less, this attack will deal double the damage.

name: Bubble
effect: A spray of countless bubbles is jetted at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their Speed stats.

name: Bubble Beam
effect: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the target. This may also lower its Speed stat.

name: Bug Bite
effect: The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.

name: Bug Buzz
effect: The user generates a damaging sound wave by vibration. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

name: Bulk Up
effect: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, boosting both its Attack and Defense stats.

name: Bulldoze
effect: The user strikes everything around it by stomping on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of those hit.

name: Bullet Punch
effect: The user strikes the target with tough punches as fast as bullets. This move always goes first.

name: Bullet Seed
effect: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.

name: Calm Mind
effect: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

name: Captivate
effect: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target is charmed into harshly lowering its Sp. Atk stat.

name: Charge
effect: The user boosts the power of the Electric move it uses on the next turn. It also raises the user's Sp. Def stat.

name: Charge Beam
effect: The user attacks with an electric charge. This may also boost the user's Sp. Atk stat.

name: Charm
effect: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly, making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s Attack stat.

name: Chatter
effect: The user attacks the target with sound waves of deafening chatter. This confuses the target.

name: Chip Away
effect: Looking for an opening, the user strikes continuously. The target's stat changes don't affect this attack.

name: Circle Throw
effect: The target is thrown, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle.

name: Clamp
effect: The target is clamped and squeezed by the user's shell for four to five turns.

name: Clear Smog
effect: The user attacks by throwing a clump of special mud. All stat changes are returned to normal.

name: Close Combat
effect: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. Lowers user's Defense and Sp. Def.

name: Coil
effect: The user coils up and concentrates. Raises Attack, Defense, and Accuracy.

name: Comet Punch
effect: The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike two to five times in a row.

name: Confide
effect: The user tells the target a secret, lowering the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: Confuse Ray
effect: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.

name: Confusion
effect: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. May also confuse the target.

name: Constrict
effect: The user constricts the target, reducing its Speed stat.

name: Conversion
effect: Changes user's type to match one of its moves.

name: Conversion 2
effect: Changes user's type to a type resistant to last move it was hit by.

name: Copycat
effect: The user mimics the move used immediately before it. The move fails if no other move has been used yet.

name: Cosmic Power
effect: The user absorbs a mysterious power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

name: Cotton Guard
effect: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton, drastically raising the Defense stat.

name: Cotton Spore
effect: The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their Speed stats.

name: Counter
effect: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack, inflicting double the damage taken.

name: Covet
effect: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target's held item.

name: Crabhammer
effect: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.

name: Crafty Shield
effect: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. It does not stop damaging moves.

name: Cross Chop
effect: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. Critical hits land more easily.

name: Cross Poison
effect: A slashing attack with a poisonous blade. Critical hits land more easily and may poison the target.

name: Crunch
effect: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

name: Crush Claw
effect: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

name: Crush Grip
effect: The user crushes the target with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move's power.

name: Curse
effect: A move that works differently for Ghost-type Pokémon. Reduces user Speed but raises Attack and Defense.

name: Cut
effect: The target is cut with a scythe or claw. It can also be used to cut down thin trees.

name: Dark Pulse
effect: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. It may also make the target flinch.

name: Dark Void
effect: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.

name: Defend Order
effect: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

name: Defense Curl
effect: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.

name: Defog
effect: A strong wind blows away obstacles such as Reflect, Light Screen, Spikes, etc.

name: Destiny Bond
effect: If the user faints, the foe that landed the knockout hit also faints.

name: Detect
effect: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if used in succession.

name: Dig
effect: The user burrows, then attacks on the next turn.

name: Disable
effect: For four turns, this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.

name: Disarming Voice
effect: Letting out a charming cry, the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.

name: Discharge
effect: The user strikes everything around it by letting loose a flare of electricity. May cause paralysis.

name: Dive
effect: Dives underwater on the first turn, then hits on the second.

name: Dizzy Punch
effect: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches that may also leave it confused.

name: Doom Desire
effect: Two turns after this move is used, a concentrated bundle of light blasts the target.

name: Double Hit
effect: The user slams the target with a long tail, vines, etc. The target is hit twice in a row.

name: Double Kick
effect: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.

name: Double Team
effect: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

name: Double-Edge
effect: A reckless, life-risking tackle. The user also takes serious damage.

name: Draco Meteor
effect: Comets are summoned down from the sky onto the target. The attack's recoil harshly lowers the user's Sp. Atk.

name: Dragon Breath
effect: The user exhales a mighty gust that may also leave the target with paralysis.

name: Dragon Claw
effect: The user slashes the target with huge, sharp claws.

name: Dragon Dance
effect: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that boosts its Attack and Speed stats.

name: Dragon Pulse
effect: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user's gaping mouth.

name: Dragon Rage
effect: This attack hits the target with a shock wave of pure rage. This attack always inflicts 40 HP damage.

name: Dragon Rush
effect: The user tackles the target while exhibiting overwhelming menace. It may make the target flinch.

name: Dragon Tail
effect: The target is knocked away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. Ends wild battles.

name: Drain Punch
effect: An energy-draining punch. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

name: Draining Kiss
effect: The user steals the target's HP with a kiss. The user's HP is restored by over half the damage taken by the target.

name: Dream Eater
effect: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

name: Drill Peck
effect: A corkscrewing attack with a sharp beak that strikes the target.

name: Drill Run
effect: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

name: Dual Chop
effect: The user attacks its target by hitting it with brutal strikes. The target is hit twice in a row.

name: Dynamic Punch
effect: The user punches the target with full, concentrated power. This confuses the target if it hits.

name: Earth Power
effect: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. May lower the target's Sp. Def.

name: Earthquake
effect: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

name: Echoed Voice
effect: The user attacks with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, its power is increased.

name: Eerie Impulse
effect: The user's body generates an eerie impulse. Sharply lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.

name: Egg Bomb
effect: A large egg is hurled at the target with maximum force to inflict damage.

name: Electric Terrain
effect: The user turns the ground into Electric Terrain for five turns, boosting Electric-type moves.

name: Electrify
effect: If the target is about to use a move, that move becomes Electric-type this turn.

name: Electro Ball
effect: The faster the user is than the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Electroweb
effect: The user captures and attacks opposing Pokémon using an electric net. Reduces Speed.

name: Ember
effect: The target is attacked with small flames. May cause a burn.

name: Encore
effect: The user compels the target to keep using the move it last used for three turns.

name: Endeavor
effect: The user attacks the target, causing damage equal to the user's remaining HP.

name: Endure
effect: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. May fail if used in succession.

name: Energy Ball
effect: The user draws power from nature and fires it. May lower the target's Sp. Def.

name: Entrainment
effect: The user dances with the target to make it catch the user’s Ability.

name: Eruption
effect: The user attacks in an explosive fury. The lower the user's HP, the less powerful it becomes.

name: Explosion
effect: The user explodes to inflict damage on everyone nearby. The user faints after using this move.

name: Extrasensory
effect: The user attacks with an odd power that may also make the target flinch.

name: Extreme Speed
effect: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This move always goes first.

name: Facade
effect: This attack's power is doubled if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.

name: Fairy Wind
effect: The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target with it.

name: Fake Out
effect: Hits first and causes flinching. Only usable on the first turn the user is out.

name: Fake Tears
effect: The user feigns crying to make the target lower its Sp. Def.

name: Feather Dance
effect: The user covers the target with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.

name: Feint
effect: An attack that hits Pokémon using moves like Protect or Detect. Also breaks those moves.

name: Feint Attack
effect: The user approaches the target disarmingly, then hits without fail.

name: Fell Stinger
effect: If this move knocks out a target, the user's Attack stat sharply increases.

name: Fiery Dance
effect: Cloaked in flames, the user dances and flares up. May raise the user's Sp. Atk stat.

name: Final Gambit
effect: The user risks everything to attack the target. It faints but inflicts damage equal to its HP.

name: Fire Blast
effect: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. May leave target with a burn.

name: Fire Fang
effect: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. May cause a burn or flinch.

name: Fire Lash
effect: The user strikes with a flame-cloaked lash. It also lowers the target's Defense.

name: Fire Pledge
effect: Can be used with Grass or Water Pledge for extra effect. Combos create sea of fire or rainbow.

name: Fire Punch
effect: The target is punched with a fiery fist. May leave the target with a burn.

name: Fire Spin
effect: The target becomes trapped in an intense spiral of fire for four to five turns.

name: First Impression
effect: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.

name: Fishious Rend
effect: If the user moves before the target, the power of this move doubles.

name: Fissure
effect: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. Instant KO if it hits.

name: Flail
effect: The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP the user has, the greater the power.

name: Flame Burst
effect: The user attacks the target with a bursting flame. Nearby Pokémon also get burned.

name: Flame Charge
effect: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks. It also raises the user’s Speed stat.

name: Flame Wheel
effect: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. May cause a burn.

name: Flamethrower
effect: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. May cause a burn.

name: Flare Blitz
effect: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges. It may burn the target and causes recoil damage.

name: Flash
effect: The user flashes a bright light that lowers the target’s accuracy.

name: Flash Cannon
effect: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it. May lower Sp. Def.

name: Flatter
effect: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However, it also raises the target’s Sp. Atk.

name: Fling
effect: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. Its power and effect depend on the item.

name: Flip Turn
effect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon.

name: Floaty Fall
effect: The user floats in the air, then dives at a steep angle. May make the target flinch.

name: Floral Healing
effect: The user restores the target’s HP. It restores more HP when used in grassy terrain.

name: Flower Shield
effect: All Grass-type Pokémon on the field get their Defense stat raised.

name: Flying Press
effect: This move is both Fighting and Flying type. May be super effective on multiple types.

name: Focus Blast
effect: The user attacks with a burst of energy. May lower the target's Sp. Def.

name: Focus Energy
effect: The user takes a deep breath and focuses to raise its critical-hit ratio.

name: Focus Punch
effect: If the user is hit before it can execute the move, it flinches instead of attacking.

name: Follow Me
effect: The user draws attention to itself, making all foes target it during the next turn.

name: Force Palm
effect: The user attacks with a shock wave. May leave the target with paralysis.

name: Foresight
effect: The user enables a Ghost-type target to be hit with Normal and Fighting moves.

name: Forest’s Curse
effect: Adds the Grass type to the target’s type.

name: Foul Play
effect: The user turns the target’s power against it. The higher the target’s Attack, the greater the damage.

name: Freeze-Dry
effect: Super effective on Water types. May also freeze the target.

name: Freezing Glare
effect: The user shoots psychic power from its eyes to attack. May freeze the target.

name: Frenzy Plant
effect: A powerful attack that also leaves the user immobile the next turn.

name: Frost Breath
effect: Always results in a critical hit.

name: Frustration
effect: Power increases the less the Pokémon likes its trainer.

name: Fury Attack
effect: The target is jabbed repeatedly—2 to 5 times in a row.

name: Fury Cutter
effect: Power increases if it hits in succession.

name: Fury Swipes
effect: The target is raked with sharp claws 2 to 5 times in a row.

name: Fusion Bolt
effect: Power increases if Fusion Flare was used before it in the same turn.

name: Fusion Flare
effect: Power increases if Fusion Bolt was used before it in the same turn.

name: Future Sight
effect: Two turns after this move is used, the target is attacked.

name: Gastro Acid
effect: The user releases a horrible fluid that suppresses the target's Ability.

name: Gear Grind
effect: The user attacks by throwing two steel gears at the target.

name: Gear Up
effect: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of allies with the Plus or Minus Ability.

name: Giga Drain
effect: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken.

name: Giga Impact
effect: A powerful charge attack that requires a recharge turn.

name: Gigavolt Havoc
effect: Z-Move power based on base move. Devastates target with Electric energy.

name: Glaciate
effect: The user attacks by blowing cold air. It lowers the target’s Speed stat.

name: Glare
effect: The user intimidates the target with a scary face to cause paralysis.

name: Grass Knot
effect: The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Grass Pledge
effect: Used with Fire or Water Pledge, creates different effects.

name: Grass Whistle
effect: The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.

name: Grassy Glide
effect: Increases priority when used in Grassy Terrain.

name: Grassy Terrain
effect: Turns the ground to grass for 5 turns. Restores HP and boosts Grass-type moves.

name: Gravity
effect: Gravity is intensified for five turns, preventing moves like Fly and Levitate-based abilities.

name: Growl
effect: The user growls in an endearing way, making the foe less wary. Lowers Attack.

name: Growth
effect: The user’s body grows all at once, raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

name: Grudge
effect: If the user faints, the PP of the opponent’s last move is reduced to 0.

name: Guard Split
effect: Averages Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.

name: Guard Swap
effect: Swaps Defense and Sp. Def with the target.

name: Guillotine
effect: A one-hit KO move. Fails if the target's level is higher.

name: Gunk Shot
effect: Shoots filthy garbage. May poison the target.

name: Gust
effect: A gust of wind is whipped up. Does double damage to Pokémon using Fly or Bounce.

name: Gyro Ball
effect: The slower the user compared to the target, the greater the damage.

name: Hail
effect: Summons a hailstorm that damages all Pokémon except Ice types.

name: Hammer Arm
effect: Swings a heavy fist. Lowers the user’s Speed.

name: Harden
effect: The user stiffens all its muscles to raise its Defense stat.

name: Haze
effect: Eliminates all stat changes among all Pokémon in battle.

name: Head Smash
effect: A reckless headbutt. The user also takes serious recoil damage.

name: Headbutt
effect: The user sticks out its head and attacks. May cause flinching.

name: Heal Bell
effect: Chimes a soothing bell. Heals status conditions of the party.

name: Heal Block
effect: For 5 turns, prevents the target from using healing moves or items.

name: Heal Order
effect: The user calls out its underlings to heal it. Restores HP by half.

name: Heal Pulse
effect: The user emits a healing pulse that restores the target’s HP by up to half.

name: Healing Wish
effect: The user faints and the Pokémon that replaces it has its HP and status fully healed.

name: Heart Stamp
effect: The user unleashes a strong psychic blow. May cause flinching.

name: Heart Swap
effect: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.

name: Heat Crash
effect: The heavier the user compared to the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Heat Wave
effect: The user exhales a hot blast. May also burn the target.

name: Heavy Slam
effect: The heavier the user compared to the target, the greater the damage.

name: Helping Hand
effect: Boosts the power of the ally’s attack in this turn.

name: Hex
effect: Power doubles if the target has a status condition.

name: Hidden Power
effect: The type varies based on the Pokémon’s IVs.

name: High Horsepower
effect: The user fiercely attacks with its entire body.

name: High Jump Kick
effect: A strong jump kick. If it misses, the user is hurt.

name: Hold Back
effect: The user attacks while ensuring it leaves the target with at least 1 HP.

name: Hold Hands
effect: The user and ally hold hands. Does nothing but boosts morale.

name: Horn Attack
effect: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn.

name: Horn Drill
effect: A one-hit KO move. Fails if the target is of a higher level.

name: Horn Leech
effect: The user drains the target’s HP with its horn. Restores half the damage dealt.

name: Howl
effect: The user howls, boosting its Attack stat.

name: Hurricane
effect: Strikes the target with fierce winds. May confuse the target.

name: Hydro Cannon
effect: The user blasts the target with a huge volume of water. The user must recharge next turn.

name: Hydro Pump
effect: Blasts water at high power to damage the opponent.

name: Hydro Vortex
effect: A Z-Move powered-up Water attack based on the user's original move.

name: Hyper Beam
effect: Powerful beam attack. The user must recharge next turn.

name: Hyper Fang
effect: Bites with sharp fangs. May cause the target to flinch.

name: Hyper Voice
effect: The user lets out a loud shout to damage opposing Pokémon.

name: Hyperspace Fury
effect: Lowers the user's Defense. Only Hoopa Unbound can use this move.

name: Hyperspace Hole
effect: Ignores moves like Protect. Only Hoopa Confined can use.

name: Hypnosis
effect: Induces sleep in the target.

name: Ice Ball
effect: Hits for 5 turns, power doubles each turn if it doesn't miss.

name: Ice Beam
effect: Blasts freezing energy. May freeze the target.

name: Ice Burn
effect: Charges on first turn, attacks second. May burn the target.

name: Ice Fang
effect: May cause flinching or freeze the target.

name: Ice Hammer
effect: Lowers the user's Speed after attack.

name: Ice Punch
effect: May freeze the opponent.

name: Ice Shard
effect: Hits first. A priority Ice move.

name: Icicle Crash
effect: May cause the opponent to flinch.

name: Icicle Spear
effect: Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

name: Icy Wind
effect: Lowers the Speed of all adjacent opponents.

name: Imprison
effect: Prevents foes from using moves that the user also knows.

name: Incinerate
effect: Destroys the target’s held Berry.

name: Inferno
effect: Always burns the target if it hits.

name: Inferno Overdrive
effect: A Z-Move powered-up Fire attack based on the user's original move.

name: Infestation
effect: Traps and damages the opponent for 4–5 turns.

name: Ingrain
effect: The user plants roots to restore HP each turn but cannot switch out.

name: Instruct
effect: The target uses its last move again immediately.

name: Ion Deluge
effect: Changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type.

name: Iron Defense
effect: Sharply raises the user’s Defense stat.

name: Iron Head
effect: May cause the target to flinch.

name: Iron Tail
effect: May lower the target’s Defense.

name: Jaw Lock
effect: Both the user and target are prevented from switching.

name: Jet Punch
effect: A priority punch of water.

name: Judgment
effect: Type depends on the Plate held by Arceus.

name: Jump Kick
effect: If it misses, the user takes damage.

name: Jungle Healing
effect: Heals HP and status of the user and allies.

name: Karate Chop
effect: High critical-hit ratio.

name: Kinesis
effect: Lowers the target’s accuracy.

name: King’s Shield
effect: Protects and lowers the Attack of attackers on contact.

name: Knock Off
effect: Removes the target’s held item.

name: Kowtow Cleave
effect: Never misses.

name: Land's Wrath
effect: The user gathers the energy of the land and focuses it on the target.

name: Laser Focus
effect: Guarantees that the user's next move will be a critical hit.

name: Lash Out
effect: Power doubles if the user's stats were lowered this turn.

name: Last Resort
effect: Can only be used after all other moves have been used.

name: Last Respects
effect: Power increases for each fainted ally.

name: Lava Plume
effect: May burn the target. Hits all adjacent Pokémon.

name: Leaf Blade
effect: High critical-hit ratio.

name: Leaf Storm
effect: Sharply lowers the user's Sp. Atk.

name: Leaf Tornado
effect: May lower the target’s accuracy.

name: Leech Life
effect: User recovers HP equal to half the damage dealt.

name: Leech Seed
effect: Plants a seed that saps HP from the target each turn.

name: Leer
effect: Lowers the Defense of all adjacent foes.

name: Lick
effect: May paralyze the target.

name: Life Dew
effect: Restores a little HP to the user and allies.

name: Light of Ruin
effect: User takes recoil damage equal to half the damage dealt.

name: Light Screen
effect: Halves damage from special moves for 5 turns.

name: Liquidation
